review: I initially bought this thinking I could get rid of cable. It worked brilliantly for a few weeks.I used the prime downloads, and watched a lot. Then I started to download, an an update came along. I can no longer use my amazon account to cast to my TV. Yes, I can still use my netflix account, but I wanted my Amazon account as well. What workd before is now broken, and I have a crying kid since the movie I bought for her thinking it was going to show on the TV didn't work as it was promised. I love Amazon prime, but I am disgusted at Amazon offering something and then taking it away without notice. Save your money and go with a Roku box. At least that still works as originally sold to me.
author: Stacy Hudson

review: Our TV came with NETFLIX installed, but it always took a long time to load - I mean several minutes, if at all - and many times it would kick us out right in the middle of a program. VERY FRUSTRATING! It got to the point where we seldom watched NETFLIX on that TV and only used it on our iPad/iPhones.This unit is very compact when compared to Apple TV and easily hides behind the TV nicely. It plugs into an HDMI port and the power cable (included, but not shown) simply plugs into a USB port. If you wish to continue using cable or satellite, make sure your TV has extra ports!A minor downside is having to use your smartphone for the remote after the installation of the Chromecast app. Normal sleep setting will have your phone blink out, which requires it to be booted again before you can pause, rewind, adjust volume or go to another show.That said, this is way, WAY better than fighting with any cranky TV's operating system.As for Apple TV, I just purchased one of those and will be installing it shortly. Another review will be forthcoming.Update: Gave the Apple TV to my son, who loves it. We're waiting for some of the reported shortcomings to be worked out of Amazon's Fire TV before purchasing one of those units.

review: We already have a Roku for the living room and wanted something that allowed us to watch Netflix and listen to Pandora in our bedroom. Plus, it's significantly cheaper than a Roku -- overall, very glad we bought it.
